meanings.definition: A person who insists on strict adherence to a particular set of standards or rules.
meanings.sent1: The sticklers in the group always make sure everyone follows the rules.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was a stickler for punctuality, never allowing students to be late.
meanings.sent3: The sticklers at the party made sure no one spilled any drinks on the carpet.
meanings.sent4: She was a stickler for details, noticing even the smallest mistakes in the report.
meanings.sent5: The sticklers for cleanliness kept the office spotless at all times.

meanings.definition: Something that is difficult to remove or get rid of.
meanings.sent1: The gum under the table was a real stickler to clean up.
meanings.sent2: Stains on the carpet can be sticklers to remove completely.
meanings.sent3: The sticky tape proved to be a stickler when trying to wrap the gift.
meanings.sent4: The old wallpaper was a stickler to peel off the walls.
meanings.sent5: The rust on the metal was a stubborn stickler to scrub off.
